input:
Homework

Decide whether the word "expect" is used with the same meaning in the two following sentences. Answer by yes or no.
I expect to receive wages.
We were expecting a visit from our relatives.

Homework

Decide whether the word "log" is used with the same meaning in the two following sentences. Answer by yes or no.
They kept a log of all transmission by the radio station.
An email log.

Homework

Decide whether the word "professionalization" is used with the same meaning in the two following sentences. Answer by yes or no.
The professionalization of warfare.
The professionalization of American sports.

Homework

Decide whether the word "tradecraft" is used with the same meaning in the two following sentences. Answer by yes or no.
The CIA chief of station accepted responsibility for his agents' failures of tradecraft.
Instructional designers are trained in something that might be called tradecraft.

Homework

Decide whether the word "dimple" is used with the same meaning in the two following sentences. Answer by yes or no.
The accident created a dimple in the hood of the car.
There are approximately 336 dimples on a golf ball.

Homework

Decide whether the word "bridge" is used with the same meaning in the two following sentences. Answer by yes or no.
Her glasses left marks on the bridge of her nose.
Rugby players often break the bridge of their noses.
